Erikson Institute is the premier early childhood development organization committed to ensuring that all children have equitable opportunities to realize their potential.
Erikson Institute is the premier independent institution of higher education committed to ensuring that all children have equitable opportunities to realize their potential.

Infant Mental Health Certificate Program Scholarship

Infant and Early Childhood Mental Health Concentration

Hone your professional skills, learn new techniques and earn the continuing education credits required to maintain your professional license in one of our many programs created to accelerate your professional development.
Through our innovative programs, we reach professionals in many settings, including homes, schools, and community organizations, helping them increase their capacity to serve children and families.

Beyond our groundbreaking education programs, we deepen our impact by providing service and support to families, creating and sharing knowledge, partnering with schools and communities, and empowering informed leaders.
Early Childhood Project with the Illinois DCFS
Our research and work in the community generates new knowledge, invigorates our academic courses, and improves life for children and families in Chicago and throughout the nation.
Erikson Institute’s Policy and Leadership Department aims to ensure that all children receive equitable opportunities to achieve their full potential.
MS in Early Childhood Education, licensure track
Online Master of Science in Early Childhood Education (non-licensure)
Take the next step forward in your career with a graduate degree or certificate program
The Illinois Risk and Reach Report is a set of data tools for early childhood.
The Fussy Baby Network helps families struggling with their infants’ crying, sleeping or feeding.
Shop for all your Erikson merchandise needs in our online store.
The premier graduate school in child development, early education, and social work
An Erikson Institute degree can help you make a difference for young children and their families.
Put your passion to work with an MSW degree.
At Erikson, we are committed to creating a supportive community that emphasizes social justice, relationship-based education, and reflective practice — the hallmark of the Erikson experience.
Post-MSW Professional Educator License (PEL) option for MSW

Hone your skills affordably and flexibly with our 100% online MS in Early Childhood Education program featuring guaranteed scholarships funding, full – and part-time options, and six in-demand concentrations.

Or take your child life practice to the next level with knowledge, tools and approaches that can delivery better outcomes in child life programs. Learn more about the new fully online program that includes full- and part-time options and available Erikson scholarships.
Online Master of Science in Early Childhood Education
Online Master of Science in Child Development
Look to us for knowledge and insight.
Our applied research generates new knowledge and invigorates our academic curriculum.
We help leaders enhance their capacity to positively influence early childhood policy.
Our conferences and customized training for professionals are led by experts in childhood development, early education, and social work.
Our faculty members are recognized scholars and respected voices for children and families.
The Edward Neisser Library is a supportive resource for students, faculty, staff, and alumni.
Our alumni are a global community serving the needs of young children and their families.
Concerned about your child’s behavior? Our clinical team provides mental health services for families with children birth to age 8.
Our infant specialists provide support over the phone and in homes for families struggling with their infants’ crying, sleeping, and feeding.
We help adults who work with children and families deepen their skills and knowledge, improving their capacity to provide support.
Early Childhood Advocates Support Illinois Commission On Equitable Funding For Early Childhood Education And Care
Erikson Institute’s 2019 Luncheon will honor Sara Crown Star and Dr. Sakena Yacoobi
Golden Apple to Honor Erikson Institute Co-Founder Barbara T. Bowman With 2019 Impact Award
Make a gift to Erikson to strengthen and sustain work that has limitless, lifelong influence on young children and their families. And that gives every gift meaning beyond measure.
We are excited to announce Erikson now offers a range of merchandise for purchase in our online store, located on CafePress. Check back often, as our stock will always be changing and expanding!
